FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.Email for .NET is a collection of components for working with email from within ASP.NET web applications, web services or Windows applications. It makes it easy to work with Outlook PST, EML, MSG and MHT files. Aspose.Email makes it easy to work with HTML or plain text emails and their attachments. It allows developers to work against SMTP, POP, FTP and Microsoft Exchange servers. It supports mail merge and iCalendar features, customized header and body, retrieving content, header information and embedded files and much more.
FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes: Bug Fixes: NETWORKNET-33272 - A Task in MSG format when added to PersonalStorage loses much information NETWORKNET-33277 - Partial information lost from .eml when converted to .msg or saved to .pst NETWORKNET-33279 - Application halts when opening .EML with Subject starting from "=?iso-8859-1?Q?" NETWORKNET-33284 - Content Type Exception at MailMessage.Load NETWORKNET-33285 - Apose.Email halts while reading a message from Lotus Notes Format (NSF) PST NETWORKNET-33286 - Garbage characters are shown when attached message is converted to MHT NETWORKNET-33307 - Application hangs while loading EML file NETWORKNET-33280 - Appointment is saved in PST. This PST crashes when opened in Outlook NETWORKNET-33205 - System.ArgumentException: Email address is not valid - MapiMessage.ToMapiMessageItem() NETWORKNET-33264 - Attachments lost while converting from .eml to .msg. Specially .vcf files are corrupted NETWORKNET-33265 - Exception raised when headers accessed in MapiMessage NETWORKNET-33266 - Invalid Content Type error while accessing Headers collection of MapiMessage NETWORKNET-33273 - System.ArgumentException: "Offset and length were out of bounds..." at MapiMessage.BodyHtml NETWORKNET-33274 - System.FormatException: "An invalid character was found in the mail header." at MailAddress ctor NETWORKNET-33276 - Meeting item's partial information lost when added to PST (created using PersonalStorage) NETWORKNET-33290 - System.ArgumentException: The ContentID cannot contain a '<' or '>'. at MailMessage.Load NETWORKNET-33295 - While opening a Contact, application crashes with message "Email address is not valid" NETWORKNET-33297 - Actual email subject is "Private". Aspose.Email displays it NULL NETWORKNET-33298 - Image in email is not retrievable after adding email to PST NETWORKNET-33303 - ArgumentNullException:"Value can not be null" at MapiMessage.FromFile().ToMapiMessageItem() NETWORKNET-33313 - Assertion is raised when message is extracted from inbox of the PST NETWORKNET-33314 - NullReferenceException: "Object reference not set to.." at PersonalStorage.ExtractMessage()
FeedPackage.Summary: Aspose.Email for .NET is a collection of components for working with email from within .NET applications
FeedPackage.Tags: Aspose.Email .NET MSG EML MHT PST OST Exchange Pop3 SMTP IMAP Outlook
FeedPackage.Title: Aspose.Email

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.Email for .NET is a collection of components for working with email from within ASP.NET web applications, web services or Windows applications. It makes it easy to work with Outlook PST, EML, MSG and MHT files. Aspose.Email makes it easy to work with HTML or plain text emails and their attachments. It allows developers to work against SMTP, POP, FTP and Microsoft Exchange servers. It supports mail merge and iCalendar features, customized header and body, retrieving content, header information and embedded files and much more.
FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes:
New Features NETWORKNET-33228 - Ability to specify different return address than Sender in case an email bounces using SmtpClient NETWORKNET-33253 - Ability to get the Version Info of Exchange Server NETWORKNET-33318 - Added MapiPropertyTag.PR_LAST_VERB_EXECUTION_TIME Property NETWORKNET-33319 - Added MapiPropertyTag.PR_FLAG_STATUS and MapiPropertyTag.PR_FLAG_ICON properties NETWORKNET-33327 - Added the functionality to create standard folders in PST NETWORKNET-33304 - Provided means to check if a given PST is Unicode or ASCII
Enhancement NETWORKNET-33306 - Enhanced MapiMessage to preserve the previously set flags NETWORKNET-33302 - Proxy property added to ExchangeWebServiceClient NETWORKNET-33312 - Provided means to insert calendar appointment into a PST
Bugs NETWORKNET-33238 - Issue in Receiving notifications for successfully sent and failed messages while using SmtpClient NETWORKNET-33257 - ExchangeWebServiceClient ListMessages can't filter based on "date query" NETWORKNET-33268 - Different behavior of folders (as compared to Outlook) when added to Personal Storage NETWORKNET-33292 - MailMessage recipients for CC and BCC dont get mails NETWORKNET-33310 - ImapClient Timeout does not work NETWORKNET-33315 - Problem in output due to difference in MapiMessage.BodyHtml and MAPI property PR_HTML NETWORKNET-33320 - MailMessage cannot recognize the uuencoded attachments NETWORKNET-33341 - After deleting messages from the Deleted Items still show number of unread messages in folder NETWORKNET-33339 - Attachment.Name returns an empty string NETWORKNET-33275 - Cannot mark newly created PST as Default NETWORKNET-33322 - Mail headers show garbage characters instead of chinese characters (.NET) NETWORKNET-33317 - MapiMessage.MessageClass has incorrect comment
Exceptions NETWORKNET-33229 - ImapException:"008 BAD Could not parse command" at ImapClient.CopyMessage when FolderName has space NETWORKNET-33300 - Error (Index was outside the bounds of the array) in loading and saving EML NETWORKNET-33301 - NullReferenceException on Pop3Client.FetchMessage NETWORKNET-33325 - IndexOutOfRangeException: Index was outside the bounds of the array at MailMessage.Load NETWORKNET-33338 - ArgumentException is thrown when calling MailMessage.Save() NETWORKNET-33348 - ArgumentException "The specified string is not in the form required for a subject." NETWORKNET-33311 - ImapException "006 NO Mailbox does not exist" at ImapClient.ListMessage(int) NETWORKNET-33213 - InvalidOperationException: "Response is not well-formed XML" at ExchangeWebServiceClient.AppendMessage() NETWORKNET-33328 - Exception thrown when Email message contains content type with erroneous format NETWORKNET-33345 - ImapClient.ListMessages Exception: The specified string is not in the form required for a subject.
FeedPackage.Summary: Aspose.Email for .NET is a collection of components for working with email from within .NET applications
FeedPackage.Tags: Aspose.Email .NET MSG EML MHT PST OST Exchange Pop3 SMTP IMAP Outlook

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.Email for .NET is a collection of components for working with email from within ASP.NET web applications, web services or Windows applications. It makes it easy to work with Outlook PST, EML, MSG and MHT files. Aspose.Email makes it easy to work with HTML or plain text emails and their attachments. It allows developers to work against SMTP, POP, FTP and Microsoft Exchange servers. It supports mail merge and iCalendar features, customized header and body, retrieving content, header information and embedded files and much more.
FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes:
Bug Fixes NETWORKNET-33347 - Special char "ì" is converted to square when EML is converted to Mhtml NETWORKNET-33353 - Priority not displayed while saving an Eml message into a Mhtml file NETWORKNET-33360 - Property Fields of the extracted message get changed NETWORKNET-33365 - How to set container class for any PST folder NETWORKNET-33367 - How to get the Email Address of current MailBox using ExchangeWebServiceClient? NETWORKNET-33371 - Setting the Time Zone on Appointments NETWORKNET-33374 - EML files Hanging MailMessage.Load NETWORKNET-33379 - Error "Object Reference not set to an instance of object" while loading EML NETWORKNET-33380 - Aspose.Email for .NET - Attachment File Name Corruption (#42009) NETWORKNET-33381 - Email Property gets merged when extracted from PST NETWORKNET-33382 - Some text in the start of an EML extracted from MBOXRD NETWORKNET-33383 - MapiCalendar.save fails to save recurring events on Calendar NETWORKNET-33384 - System.InvalidCastException on trying to extract Calendar items from a PST
Enhancements NETWORKNET-33235 - Avoid expired/bad server certificate while using Aspose.Email.Mail.SmtpClient
New Features NETWORKNET-33324 - Set follow up flag and due date for a message NETWORKNET-33346 - Add Contacts to Exchange NETWORKNET-33368 - Log Activity for Aspose.Email.Mail.SmtpClient

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.Email for .NET is a collection of components for working with email from within ASP.NET web applications, web services or Windows applications. It makes it easy to work with Outlook PST, EML, MSG and MHT files.
FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes:
Bugs NETWORKNET-33376 - Embedded MSG attachment gets corrupted when loading the input MSG file NETWORKNET-33415 - Attachments not detected by MailMessage.Load() and MapiMessage.FromMailMessage() NETWORKNET-33425 - Msg with Bullet Points cannot be converted to TIFF NETWORKNET-33426 - Message Body Formatting Lost with Appointments Attachment NETWORKNET-33428 - Attachments and Body text problem when EML is loaded into MailMessage NETWORKNET-33431 - MAPI message from MailMessage - NULL pointer exception NETWORKNET-33432 - Aspose.iCalendar.RecurrencePattern load wrong DTSTART NETWORKNET-33438 - Reccurence pattern is converted incorrectly from MailMessage to MapiMessage NETWORKNET-33439 - Exception at MapiCalendar.Save() NETWORKNET-33442 - Time zone of Fetched appointment is not the same as original appointment NETWORKNET-33443 - FolderInfo.AddMessage does not add MapiMessage properly that contains MSG as an attachment NETWORKNET-33445 - FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes:
Major Features and Improvements
* Bulk deletion and update of messages in PST * Support for Gmail IMAP protocol extensions * ImapClient: Delete and change message flags for set of messages * Use mail server IP address for connecting the ImapClient and Pop3Client without DNS resolution * Option to read X-APPLE-FILENAME for attachments in ICS from IOS * Improvement of copy method. Add ability to "copy" multiple messages per invocation

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.Email for Android via Xamarin is a collection of components for working with email from within your Xamarin.Android applications. It makes it easy to work with Outlook PST, EML, MSG and MHT files as well as with popular email servers and protocols.
FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes:
Aspose.Email for Android via Xamarin 17.7 Release Notes
This is the first release of Aspose.Email for Android via Xamarin. In future regular monthly releases will be published. Aspose.Email for Xamarin.Android has full functionality of Aspose.Email for .NET with few limitations, minor API changes and additional requirements.
With the launch of this API, Android developers are able to develop applications capable of functionality offered by Aspose.Email API. These include: Popular messages format processing including Microsoft Outlook MSG files Specify email sender, recipients, subject and body Use the API’s SMTP client to send emails Use POP3 and IMAP clients for retrieving emails from server Communicate with Exchange Servers (WebDav and EWS) for sending emails, meetings and retrieving other information Work with calendar objects Work with Outlook storage files i.e. PST and OST Working with Thunderbird storage files
FeedPackage.Summary: Aspose.Email for Android via Xamarin is a class library for Xamarin.Android that enables you to work with Email file formats and popular network protocols.
FeedPackage.Tags: Email eml msg pst outlook exchange imap smtp pop3 Xamarin Android
FeedPackage.Title: Aspose.Email.Android.Xamarin

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.Email for Cloud is a REST API for creating email archiving applications that work with common email file formats. It lets developers manipulate message formats such as MSG, EML, and MHT files. The API supports many common tasks, for example accessing messages, reading message properties such as sender, receiver, message sent date, and message details. It also supports converting messages back and forth between EML, MSG and MHT formats. With Aspose.Email for Cloud, it is further possible to access messages and retrieve attachments that can then be saved to a local disc. The robust API saves developers time and effort when programming with emails in the cloud.
FeedPackage.Title: Aspose.Email-Cloud

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.Html for .NET allows to create, load, edit or convert (X)HTML documents without requiring additional software or tools. Along with manipulation functions, the API also provides the high fidelity rendering engine for fixed-layout formats such as PDF & XPS, and a number of raster image formats.
FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes: We are pleased to announce to first public release of Aspose.Html for .NET. This API offers the capabilities to create as well as manipulate HTML files. It also provides the features to iterate through HTML elements, Nodes, extract CSS information, edit or remove HTML nodes, configure a document sandbox which affects the processing of CSS styles, rendering of HTML to PDF, XPS or raster image formats and much more. Please visit Product Features page for further details and get the chance to download first release of Aspose.Html for .NET.
FeedPackage.Summary: Aspose.Html for .NET is an advanced HTML manipulation API that enables you to perform a wide range of HTML manipulation tasks directly within your .NET applications.
FeedPackage.Tags: Aspose.Html HTML XHTML DOM CSS XPATH EPUB MHTML render converter PDF XPS image graphic TIFF JPEG PNG BMP
FeedPackage.Title: Aspose.Html

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.Imaging for .NET is an imaging library for all kind of image formats support, conversion and data manipulation.
FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes:
Aspose.Imaging for .Net has been updated to version 2.2.0 and we are pleased to announce this release brings the addition of 22 new useful improvements. A very demanded feature for tiff data recovery has been implemented in this release. The following is a list of changes in this version of Aspose.Imaging.
Major Features Data recovery for Tiff Starting from v2.2 Aspose.Imaging supports data recovery mode for tiff file format (IMAGING-33851). The data recovery allows to load any tiff file which has improper data layout or some data corruption exist. The corrupted data is replaced with some background defined and you will be able to retrieve the rest data and view its contents. This is especially useful for tiff file format since it stores the data in strips and when some strip is damaged the other strips may still retain the correct information and data recovery mode allows loading and viewing the rest strips data. To assist our customers we have also provided support for 2 data recovery modes: ConsistentRecover and MaximalRecover which may provide different results depending on the customer needs for data recovery.
Minor Features New Features (IMAGING-33470) Dithering support (IMAGING-33796) [Dxf to Pdf] Export of only specified layers (IMAGING-33536) Support CompactPalette property for the IColorPalette interface (IMAGING-27111) Jpeg file format support Enhancements (IMAGING-33908) Remove offline documentation and leave only ApiReference in chm (IMAGING-33894) Add online EULA button Bugs (IMAGING-33938) Image Saving Failed: while merging Tiff images (IMAGING-33944) Fail to save gif after load (IMAGING-33907) Gif image lost transparent color value after saving (IMAGING-33895) Investigate and fix special aligned dimension rendering (IMAGING-33867) [Dxf to Pdf] Support for metric units rendering for all dimensions (IMAGING-33849) Infinite execution on openning gif-image (IMAGING-33843) Incorrect file format on Image.GetFileFormat (IMAGING-33830) Tiff created with Aspose.Imaging does not render properly in IrfanView and ACDsee (IMAGING-33882) [Cad to Pdf] Fix bug with ellipses with start and end angles. (IMAGING-33825) [Dxf to Pdf] Fix problem with closed polylines (IMAGING-33820) An empty png image is generated when resized (IMAGING-33816) [Dxf to Pdf] Implement support of different linetypes for existing entities. (IMAGING-33811) Dxf to Pdf] Fix missed labels on dimension objects. (IMAGING-33437) Customer wants to convert 32bpp TIF sources to CCITT4 1bpp grayscale TIF Exceptions (IMAGING-33829) ImageSaveException: The stream reader has passed over the data boundary. The data is corrupt
FeedPackage.Summary: Aspose.Imaging for .NET is an imaging library that lets developers create, edit, draw or convert images in their .NET applications. Aspose.Imaging provides features that go beyond the native capabilities of the development platform. Using Aspose.Imaging for .NET you can work with bmp, gif, png, tiff, jpeg, pdf, dxf file formats in your applications. You can load, modify the image data and save it back to original file format (save to dxf is not supported yet) or convert the image to any other file format.
FeedPackage.Tags: Imaging Aspose.Imaging GIF JPEG JPG PNG BMP TIF PSD Layers Images Drawing Graphics Interlaced LZW CCITT3 CCITT4 RLE compression TiffFrame

FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes:
Aspose.Imaging for .Net has been updated to version 2.4.0 and we are pleased to announce it. The following is a list of changes in this version of Aspose.Imaging.
Major Features We are happy to announce that a long awaited feature (IMAGING-32164) of Dwg to Pdf conversion is now available. Now we support reading and conversion to Pdf of the Autocad 2004 Dwg file format (version 16.0 Release 18). We continue the hard work to support the other Autocad versions and Autocad 2010 support is currently under development. Please note we currently support the following main Autocad 2004 primitives: TEXT, MTEXT, ATTDEF, ATTRIB, ARC, ELLIPSE, HATCH, LEADER, POINT, VERTEX 2D, VERTEX 3D, POLYLINE 2D, LWPOLYLINE, RAY, CIRCLE, DIMENSION ORDINATE, DIMENSION LINEAR, DIMENSION ALIGNED, DIMENSION ANG 3Pt, DIMENSION ANG 2Ln, DIMENSION RADIUS, DIMENSION DIAMETER, SHAPE, SOLID, SPLINE, MLINE, LINE, XLINE, STYLE, DIMSTYLE, LTYPE, MLINESTYLE, LAYER, VIEWPORT, LAYOUT. Additionally we have greatly reworked the Imaging engine and improved the overall performance for bmp file format (IMAGING-34110). The bmp file format now supports raw data loading and processing of the bmp file format is now greatly improved. We will continue the raw data support and future releases will contain more file formats covering that feature.
Other Improvements and Changes New features: IMAGING-34045 [Dwg to Pdf] Add support of rendering of specified layout IMAGING-33962 Add thumbnail support to JFIF and EXIF
Enhancements: IMAGING-33958 [Dxf to Pdf] Parse custom visibility parameter for insert object IMAGING-34066 Saved JPEG images differ from source images IMAGING-34067 JpegImage.LoadPixels throws System.Exception: Unexpected marker IMAGING-34097 [Dxf to Pdf] Rotated texts fix IMAGING-34105 [Cad] Remove Cad special data types (such as CadShortParameter) IMAGING-34007 [Cad to Pdf] Implement adjustments for ATTDEF objects IMAGING-34001 Text in AttribDef object must be unvisible. IMAGING-34024 Add support for underline text rendering for multitext entity IMAGING-34079 Moving internal members to public - should be accessible via public api IMAGING-34053 Moving public members to internal - should not be accessible via public api IMAGING-34078 Process hangs when opens Tiff file IMAGING-34068 JpegImage.LoadPixels throws System.IndexOutOfRangeException IMAGING-34051 [Cad to Pdf] Hatch object is absent on a drawing IMAGING-34101 [Cad to Pdf] Fix viewports rendering IMAGING-34036 Improve colorization and interval between lines IMAGING-34111 Exception while exporting the Jpeg to Tiff: "An attempt was made to move the position before the beginning of the stream." IMAGING-34102 Cannot encode large tiff image correctly using CCITT scheme IMAGING-34069 Metadata segments allow to write thumbnails big enough to overap upper size boundary of jpeg segment. Aspose.Imaging provides features that go beyond the native capabilities of the development platform. It works independent of other applications and although Aspose.Imaging allows you to save to Adobe PhotoShop® format (PSD), you do not need PhotoShop on the machine.

New Features IMAGING-34388 Support the Jpeg Compression Method while saving TIFF images IMAGING-34372 Export more than one layouts of CAD drawings to PDF and RasterImages IMAGING-34361 Check if a license has been properly set IMAGING-34327 Support for PSD files having CMYK color mode IMAGING-34286 DWG to PDF: Support for text contents in the DWG drawings for rendering to PDF IMAGING-34284 Retrieve the size of DWG drawing IMAGING-34019 Conversion of RGB Color System to CMYK for Tiff File Format IMAGING-33748 Auto Correct the Orientation of a JPEG Image

saving PNG to GIF IMAGING-34381 ImageSaveException: Value does not fall within the expected range, while converting PNG to GIF IMAGING-34378 Bad Jpeg Quality after Re-size IMAGING-34374 Image format change from JPEG to GIF with default settings change the colors in resultant image IMAGING-34351 Update exceptions in case of incorrect values for PdfOptions size and VectorRasterizationOptions IMAGING-34340 Saved JPEG images differ from source images IMAGING-34312 Aspose.Metafiles ignore brush pattern in raster opperations (EMR_STRETCHDIBITS record) IMAGING-34311 Aspose.Metafiles ignore (EMR_EXTCREATEPEN record) IMAGING-34306 Incorrect text rendering with 'Cambria Math' font in Aspose.Metafiles IMAGING-34305 Aspose.Metafiles ignore logical brushes (EMR_CREATEBRUSHINDIRECT record) IMAGING-34304 Aspose.Metafiles ignores the text weight value (EMR_EXTCREATEFONTINDIRECTW record) IMAGING-34303 Bitmap stretching in Aspose.Metafiles works incorrectly IMAGING-34302 Kerning in Aspose.Metafiles differs from .Net IMAGING-34301 Aspose.Metafiles ignores values in Bounds field of the EMR_HEADER structure IMAGING-34285 [Investigation Required] DWG to PDF: PDF seems to be blank when large DWG is rendered to smaller canvas with ScaleType.GrowToFit IMAGING-34260 Investigate Hatch object for two attached dwg files IMAGING-34227 Investigate why some dwg tests do not work under NCover IMAGING-34206 Investigate layer entity reading for Autocad 2010 dwg format [internal] IMAGING-34159 Add more useful parameters to IPartialRawDataLoader interface IMAGING-34151 Converting a Tiff to Jpeg renders the image displaced IMAGING-34096 [Internal] Investigate some problems with specific dimension style/size
Exceptions IMAGING-34447 Thumbnails save process works incorrectly. IMAGING-34433 Exception "ImageLoadException" during ycck image loading in Imaging CF build.
Public API and Backwards Incompatible Changes Property Aspose.Imaging.ImageOptions.PngOptions.TransparentColor Removed. Use Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Png.PngImage.HasTransparentColor and Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Png.PngImage.TransparentColor instead. Property Aspose.Imaging.ImageOptions.CadRasterizationOptions.LayoutName removed. Use Aspose.Imaging.ImageOptions.CadRasterizationOptions.Layouts instead where you can specify several layouts at once.

Aspose.Imaging for .Net has been updated to version 3.1.0 and we are pleased to announce it. The following is a list of changes in this version of Aspose.Imaging.
New Features
IMAGING-34897 Support PSD layers loading
Enhancements
IMAGING-34934 ExifData and Comment properties in JpegImage class are always set to null after reading a JPEG image that contains these data IMAGING-34930 Gif image is damaged after saving IMAGING-34914 Image distorted after saving in Jpeg format with CMYK colorspace. IMAGING-34913 ImageLoadException: Cannot process loading further due to incorrect file format structure. Index was out of range. Must be non-negative and less than the size of the collection, while loading DWG IMAGING-34912 Converting DWG to raster image formats other Tiff renders in blank image with no Layout specified IMAGING-34911 ImageLoadException: Cannot process loading further due to incorrect file format structure. Index was out of range. Must be non-negative and less than the size of the collection, while loading DWG IMAGING-34893 Process hangs at Image.Load while loading a JPEG IMAGING-34885 ImageLoadException: Unable to read file. Exception: Unable to read values for 443 tag. Message : Cannot read 1051004 bytes from stream IMAGING-34875 Caching does not seem to be working in WebForms application IMAGING-34874 System.OverflowException: Arithmetic operation resulted in an overflow, at Image.Resize IMAGING-34870 ImageSaveException: Index was outside the bounds of the array, while converting BMP to JPEG IMAGING-34869 Additional text/mtext objects are rendered near layouts IMAGING-34858 Conversion of DWG to PDF: Result does not match with original DWG IMAGING-34857 Conversion of DWG to PDF generated a 58MB file IMAGING-34845 ImageSaveException: Cannot decode strip 0. Details: Cannot perform 2d decoding. Missing changes from previous row, at TiffFrame.Save IMAGING-34827 Class IccSegment does not load embedded ICC Profile IMAGING-34817 ImageLoadException: Cannot open an image. The image file format may be not supported at the moment, while loading a BMP IMAGING-34812 PhotometricInterpretation not defined, while validating Aspose.Imaging's generated TIFF with JHOVE IMAGING-34808 Tiff Loading throws exception TiffImageException: Cannot decode strip 0. Details: Cannot perform 2d decoding. IMAGING-34767 Improve partial processing IMAGING-34732 Image quality (Sharpness) decreases while resizing the image IMAGING-34728 PsdImage saved with blank PsdOptions and without PsdOptions are different in channels count IMAGING-34645 Remove obsolete TiffOptions constructors IMAGING-34633 Remove old dithering properties
Exceptions
IMAGING-34524 ImageLoadException: Cannot open an image. The image file format may be not supported at the moment. at Image.Load

IMAGING-34945 Exporting DWG Drawing to PDF produces invalid results IMAGING-34944 Incorrect dimensions returned for certain DXF IMAGING-34927 Converting DxF file to png or tiff, resulting in an empty output file. IMAGING-34879 FrameworkException: Cannot allocate image in memory. Image size exceeds memory size, at Image.Resize IMAGING-34878 Error in documentation/implementation for Aspose.Imaging for Save() method for PSD with concrete PsdOptions specified IMAGING-34877 Empty PSD file after Save() source PSD without max compatibility with CompressionMethod.Raw IMAGING-34876 PSD layers in result file lost after Save() call with CompressionMethod.Raw IMAGING-34664 Drawing a PNG with transparent background on another image results in a black block IMAGING-34590 Colors change when TIFF is converted to JPEG with default settings IMAGING-34345 Improve tiff loading performance

FeedPackage.Summary: Aspose.Imaging for .NET is an imaging library that lets developers create, edit, draw or convert images in their .NET applications. Aspose.Imaging provides features that go beyond the native capabilities of the development platform. It works independent of other applications and although Aspose.Imaging allows you to save to Adobe PhotoShop® format (PSD), you do not need PhotoShop on the machine.
FeedPackage.Tags: Aspose.Imaging GIF JPEG JPG JPEG2000 PNG BMP TIF PSD DXF DWG Layers Images Drawing Graphics Interlaced LZW CCITT3 CCITT4 RLE compression TiffFrame Djvu WebP DICOM Emf
FeedPackage.Title: Aspose.Imaging

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.Imaging for .NET is an imaging library that lets developers create, edit, draw or convert images in their .NET applications. Aspose.Imaging provides features that go beyond the native capabilities of the development platform. It works independent of other applications and although Aspose.Imaging allows you to save to Adobe PhotoShop® format (PSD), you do not need PhotoShop on the machine.
FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes:
Aspose.Imaging for .Net has been updated to version 3.7.0 and we are pleased to announce it. The following is a list of changes in this version of Aspose.Imaging.
New features: IMAGINGNET-1605 Support FontSettings for CAD and Emf formats IMAGINGNET-1602 Cropping for emf files IMAGINGNET-1568 Implement support for Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) 1.1 format support IMAGINGNET-1523 Ability to add / import image to PSD layer [.Net]
Enhancements: IMAGINGNET-1628 Implement Dicom loader IMAGINGNET-1595 Aspose.Imaging is rounding up the Horizontal and Vertical resolution values [Net] IMAGINGNET-1507 Aspose.Imaging drawing engine stage by stage introduction
Exceptions IMAGINGNET-1614 Jpeg2000 to Jpeg export fault IMAGINGNET-1617 Improve exception messages of vector rasterization options IMAGINGNET-1599 Watermark duplication for Djvu to Pdf export IMAGINGNET-1518 Loading PSD file throws exception using version 3.3.0 while it was working fine with version 3.0.0 [.Net]
Incompatible changes All CAD API enties are frozen and will be decomissioned soon. Please, consider migration to Aspose.CAD to continue using of CAD features.

FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes:
Aspose.Imaging for .Net has been updated to version 3.8.0 and we are pleased to announce it Aspose.Imaging for .Net has been updated to version 3.8.0 and we are pleased to announce it. The following is a list of changes in this version of Aspose.Imaging.
New features: IMAGINGNET-1567 Support Wmf file format IMAGINGNET-1863 Support for Diacom DCM image format IMAGINGNET-1855 Conversion of SVG to PNG IMAGINGNET-1832 Conversion of SVG to JPG IMAGINGNET-1828 Support for WMF for possible conversion to raster images IMAGINGNET-1827 Support for SVG to Raster Image Conversion
Enhancements: IMAGINGNET-1984 Unable to read file. Exception: The method or operation is not implemented: Exception while loading a TIFF file IMAGINGNET-1983 Exception while loading a PNG image: Could not read data IMAGINGNET-1633 Support to get the last modified day information on images IMAGINGNET-1630 Exporting images in multi threaded environment is not working IMAGINGNET-1629 Unable to load a JPG image - Image loading failed exception
Exceptions IMAGINGNET-1614 Jpeg2000 to Jpeg export fault

FeedPackage.Summary: Aspose.Imaging for .NET is an imaging library that lets developers create, edit, draw or convert images in their .NET applications. Aspose.Imaging provides features that go beyond the native capabilities of the development platform. It works independent of other applications and although Aspose.Imaging allows you to save to Adobe PhotoShop® format (PSD), you do not need PhotoShop on the machine.
FeedPackage.Tags: Aspose.Imaging GIF JPEG JPG JPEG2000 PNG BMP TIF PSD DXF DWG Layers Images Drawing Graphics Interlaced LZW CCITT3 CCITT4 RLE compression TiffFrame Djvu WebP DICOM Emf Wmf
FeedPackage.Title: Aspose.Imaging

Aspose.Imaging for .Net has been updated to version 3.9.0 and we are pleased to announce it Aspose.Imaging for .Net has been updated to version 3.9.0 and we are pleased to announce it. The following is a list of changes in this version of Aspose.Imaging.
New features: IMAGINGNET-1971 Support for SAI format [.Net] IMAGINGNET-1970 Support for GIMP2 format [.Net] IMAGINGNET-1847 Implement ability for adding both vector graphics and bitmap components to Metafile
Enhancements: IMAGINGNET-2021 Converting Djvu to Pdf file contains black pages only instead of image in it IMAGINGNET-2018 Djvu extracted pages does not contain colors IMAGINGNET-2016 Djvu converted to PDF successfully but unable to open the PDF using Adobe PDF reader IMAGINGNET-2004 Support for TEXT_AS_SHAPES while converting EMF to SVG format IMAGINGNET-2001 Updating text in text layers of a PSD file is not generating expected output and also throwing exception IMAGINGNET-1991 Investigate emf/emf+ renderer performance IMAGINGNET-1980 Implement support of Icc profiles for Jpeg2000 images IMAGINGNET-1892 PSD file has 6 layers while Aspose.Imaging shows 0 layers IMAGINGNET-1801 Rotate operation causes color lose IMAGINGNET-1631 Converting TIFF to JPEG shows exception: Image export failed, cannot parse file [.Net] IMAGINGNET-1598 Multiple export or saving of EmfImage throws an exception. IMAGINGNET-1597 Transparency issue while Extracting TIFF Frame [.Net] IMAGINGNET-2008 Support drawing embedded Wmf images IMAGINGNET-2010 Introduce notification warning regarding decomission of CAD functionality within Aspose.Imaging, that are taking place in Aspose.Imaging v.4.0 IMAGINGNET-2005 The unportable code in SvgWmfRenderer class IMAGINGNET-2017 Support Region RecorderGraphics.Clip
Incompatable changes All CAD API enties are frozen and will be decomissioned soon. Please, consider migration to Aspose.CAD to continue using of CAD features.

Aspose.Imaging for .Net has been updated to version 4.0.0 and we are pleased to announce it Aspose.Imaging for .Net has been updated to version 4.0.0 and we are pleased to announce it. The following is a list of changes in this version of Aspose.Imaging.
Public API changes: IMAGINGNET-2058 Disable CAD API within Aspose.Imaging
To continue use of CAD API in your applications, in most cases it's enaugh: a) Download and install Aspose.CAD from http://www.aspose.com/downloads/cad/net; b) Add Aspose.CAD assembly reference to your project; c) Replace Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Cad* namespaces to Aspose.CAD* in your code.
New features: IMAGINGNET-2037 Integrate metering module to promote new sales model for Aspose.Imaging
Enhancements: IMAGINGNET-2060 Multiple save of Wmf file produce wrong results IMAGINGNET-2036 Aspose.Imaging is not returning correct Height #x26 Width of WMF image IMAGINGNET-2028 Static method GetFileFormat of Image class is returning incorrect information IMAGINGNET-2003 Incorrect layer names returned from a PSD file with multiple layers and nested layers IMAGINGNET-1982 Import from Internal format to WMF IMAGINGNET-1981 Out of Memory Error Exception when trying to process TIFF image of size 500MB (.NET)

New features: IMAGINGNET-2048 Creating wmf files by calling Graphics methods (drawImage,drawLine, etc.) IMAGINGNET-1858 Support for WMF for possible conversion to SVG

FeedPackage.Summary: Aspose.Imaging for .NET is an imaging library that lets developers create, edit, draw or convert images in their .NET applications. Aspose.Imaging provides features that go beyond the native capabilities of the development platform. It works independent of other applications and although Aspose.Imaging allows you to save to Adobe PhotoShop® format (PSD), you do not need PhotoShop on the machine.

Aspose.Imaging for .Net has been updated to version 17.6 and we are pleased to announce it. The following is a list of changes in this version of Aspose.Imaging.
Breaking changes:
IMAGINGNET-2370 Aspose.Imaging SILVERLIGHT configuration decommision
The Silverlight configuration creates security risks so was decommissioned.
New Features:
IMAGINGNET-2396 Provide setting for replacing missing fonts IMAGINGNET-2343 Support for JPEG-LS with CMYK, YCCK color modes. IMAGINGNET-2342 Support for 2-7 bits per sample in JPEG-LS images. IMAGINGNET-2159 Support for JPEG-LS format IMAGINGNET-2154 Support for Raster Image to SVG Conversion
Enhancements:

FeedPackage.Title: Aspose.Imaging

FeedPackage.Description:
Aspose.Imaging for Cloud lets you use a REST API to inspect, convert, and transform images in the cloud. It supports the most popular image formats such as PSD, PNG, GIF, BMP, TIFF, and JPEG, and conversion between them.
Aspose.Imaging for Cloud also provides a rich set of features for manipulating images on-the-fly with cloud based image transformations. You can resize, crop and/or rotate images various ways by simply creating a request that includes the correct transformation instructions.
The most demanding imaging routines, for example TIFF concatenation and image conversion to fax compatible format, are available through efficient and reliable specialized resources. You can perform these operations without needing to know what's going on under the hood so that you can focus on the core business goals.

FeedPackage.Title: Aspose.Network.dll

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.Note for .NET is a class library that enables applications to interact with Microsoft Office OneNote programmatically without its installation on the server. It is a pure alternate for MS OneNote Object Model provides much better performance and ease of use to manage OneNote documents. Aspose.Note for .NET API delivers the features to read, convert, create and edit/manipulate the content of the Microsoft OneNote file format.
FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes: Major Features: - Rendering the text and images from OneNote® file to raster images(PDF, PNG, JPEG, GIF, BMP, TIFF) - Rendering the text and images from OneNote® file to Adobe ® Portable Document Format (PDF). - Navigation through the OneNote® Document Object Model. - Text Extraction - extract text from any part of OneNote® file. - Read text formatting and layout information (sizes and positions) through the object model. - Replace and insert text or other elements and export in the supported rendering formats.
FeedPackage.Tags: OneNote Note ONE PDF JPG BMP PNG Document Office
FeedPackage.Title: Aspose.Note

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.Note for .NET is a class library that enables applications to interact with Microsoft Office OneNote programmatically without its installation on the server. It is a pure alternate for MS OneNote Object Model provides much better performance and ease of use to manage OneNote documents. Aspose.Note for .NET API delivers the features to read, convert, create and edit/manipulate the content of the Microsoft OneNote file format.
FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes:
New Features: - Rendering the text with subscript or superscript formating. - Rendering the bullets list. - Rendering the numbering list. - Rendering the paragraph with spacing options(before, after, line spacing at least).
Enhancements: - The Aspose.Note assembly become CLS compliant. - The INotebookVisitor interface become as DocumentVisitor abstract class, it is allow to prevent issues with extensibility. - Improved the Document Object Model navigation. The FirstChild, LastChild, NextSibling, PreviousSibling methods were implemented.
Fixed bugs: - NOTENET-174 Exception happens when the page contains only title element. - NOTENET-177 The rendering of image inside outline element is not correct. - NOTENET-173 The measuring of text line is not correct. - NOTENET-159 Exception happens when the font does not support 'Regular' style. - NOTENET-193 The size calculation is not correct for rich text with custom spacing between lines. - NOTENET-195 The indent position is not correct for outline and outline group elements.
Public API and Backwards Incompatible Changes: - Added a new property RichText.SpaceBefore - Gets or sets the minimum amount of space before. - Added a new property RichText.SpaceAfter - Gets or sets the minimum amount of space after. - Added a new property RichText.LineSpacing - Gets or sets the line spacing. - Added a new property OutlineElement.NumberList - Gets or sets the bullet or number list for outline. - Renamed the INotebookVisitor to DocumentVisitor. - Added the new class NumberList - Specifies the numbers or bullets list.
FeedPackage.Tags: OneNote Note ONE PDF JPG BMP PNG TIFF Document Office
FeedPackage.Title: Aspose.Note

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.Note for .NET is a class library that enables applications to interact with Microsoft Office OneNote programmatically without its installation on the server. It is a pure alternate for MS OneNote Object Model provides much better performance and ease of use to manage OneNote documents. Aspose.Note for .NET API delivers the features to read, convert, create and edit/manipulate the content of the Microsoft OneNote file format.
FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes:
New Features: - Rendering of tag elements. - Rendering of task elements. - Rendering of table elements. - Rendering or attached documents. - Rendering of hyperlink elements.
Enhancements: - The DocumentVisitor abstract class became more flexible. It supports start and end methods for visiting elements of DOM.
Fixed bugs: - NOTENET-224 NotImplementedException message when loading .one (2010) document. - NOTENET-225 NullReferenceException message when exporting .one (2010) document to PDF.
Public API and Backwards Incompatible Changes: The following is a list of any changes made to the public API such as added, renamed, removed or deprecated members as well as any non-backward compatible change made to Aspose.Note for .NET. If you have concerns about any change listed below, please raise it on the Aspose.Note support forum.
- Added the new class AttachedFile – Represents an attached file. - Added the new class NoteTag - Represents a note tag. - Added the new class Table - Represents a table tag. - Added the dictionary TagIcon - Specifies the icon of tag or task - Renamed the DocumentVisitor.VisitDocument to DocumentVisitor.VisitDocumentStart. - Renamed the DocumentVisitor.VisitImage to DocumentVisitor. VisitImage Start. - Renamed the DocumentVisitor.VisitOutline to DocumentVisitor. VisitOutline Start. - Renamed the DocumentVisitor.VisitOutlineElement to DocumentVisitor. VisitOutlineElement Start. - Renamed the DocumentVisitor.VisitOutlineGroup to DocumentVisitor. VisitOutlineGroup Start. - Renamed the DocumentVisitor.VisitPage to DocumentVisitor. VisitPage Start. - Renamed the DocumentVisitor.VisitPageSeries to DocumentVisitor. VisitPageSeries Start. - Renamed the DocumentVisitor.VisitRichText to DocumentVisitor. VisitRichText Start. - Renamed the DocumentVisitor.VisitSection to DocumentVisitor. VisitSection Start. - Renamed the DocumentVisitor.VisitTitle to DocumentVisitor. VisitTitle Start. - Added a new methods DocumentVisitor.VisitDocumentEnd, DocumentVisitor.VisitImageEnd, DocumentVisitor.VisitOutlineEnd, DocumentVisitor.VisitOutlineElementEnd, DocumentVisitor.VisitOutlineGroupEnd, DocumentVisitor.VisitPageEnd, DocumentVisitor.VisitPageSeriesEnd, DocumentVisitor.VisitRichTextEnd, DocumentVisitor.VisitSectionEnd, DocumentVisitor.VisitTitleEnd, DocumentVisitor.VisitAttachedFileEnd, DocumentVisitor.VisitTableEnd, DocumentVisitor.VisitTableCellEnd, DocumentVisitor.VisitTableRowEnd – It calls after visitor visited the all children nodes. - DocumentVisitor.VisitAttachedFileStart, DocumentVisitor.VisitTableStart, DocumentVisitor.VisitTableCellStart, DocumentVisitor.VisitTableRowStart - It calls before visitor visited the first children node.
FeedPackage.Tags: OneNote Note ONE PDF JPG BMP PNG TIFF Document Office
FeedPackage.Title: Aspose.Note

Save(Stream stream, SaveFormat format)– Saves the note document to a stream in the specified format.

FeedPackage.Title: Aspose.OCR

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.OCR for .NET is a character recognition component built to allow developers to add OCR functionality in their ASP.NET web applications, web services and Windows applications. It provides a simple set of classes for controlling character recognition.
FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes:
Improvements 33243 - Update new default values for rotation parameters. 33269 - Improved recognition of garbage elements on image. 33225 - Flip detection.
Bug fixes 33244 - Fix public accessible hOCR exception. 33241 - Fix problem with recognition modes. 33230 - Fix correct notifications sending during recognition.
New features 33236 - Implement sending notification after the recognition of every page.

FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes: New features 33325 - Detect checkbox is filled or empty. 33345 - Support of radio button element. 33346 - Support of grid element

It provides a simple set of classes for controlling character and optical mark recognition
FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes:
Improvements and Changes
New Features OCR-30703 Text blocks detection
Enhancements OCR-33837 Latest version cannot correctly perform OCR on the sample provided with Aspose Examples Dashboard OCR-33814 Incorrect recognition of numbers OCR-33804 IRecognizedTextPartInfo does not return the found part type OCR-33803 Improve text and picture blocks processing algorithm OCR-33687 Incorrect results returned by OCR OCR-33664 Improve time taken to extract the text from an image OCR-33588 Unable to perform OCR on Arial 32pt Text
Exceptions OCR-33820 Engine.Text.PartsInfo[].CharactersBox isn't set OCR-33796 OcrException: "Error occurred during recognition." "Index was out of range. Must be non-negative and less than the size of the collection." OCR-28970 OutOfMemoryException
Public API and Backwards Incompatible Changes
The following is a list of any changes made to the public API such as added, renamed, removed or deprecated members as well as any non-backward compatible change made to Aspose.OCR for .NET. If you have concerns about any change listed, please raise it on the Aspose.OCR support forum.
Added APIs: Interface Aspose.OCR.IRecognizedPartInfo: Interface that presents information about part of the recognized text. Could be text or detected picture block. Property Aspose.OCR.IRecognizedPartInfo.Box: Gets the rectangular area where the detected block (with text or picture) is shown on the image. Coordinates starts with the upper left corner of the image.
Removed APIs: Property Aspose.OCR.IRecognizedTextPartInfo.Box: This property was moved to new upper level interface IRecognizedPartInfo.

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.OCR for Cloud is a cloud-based REST API for optical character recognition and document scanning. It allows you to scan documents and recognize characters. Recognize text in English and other languages, and recognize text in only part of an image. Aspose.OCR for Cloud supports a variety of fonts in different styles, like regular, bold, and italic, and different image formats. You can use Aspose.OCR for Cloud in many scenarios, for example, extracting text and saving to a database.
FeedPackage.Title: Aspose.OCR-Cloud

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.Pdf is a class library for working with PDF files
FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes:
We are pleased to share the new version of Aspose.Pdf for .NET with following improvements:
New Features PDFNEWNET-10208 PDF to PDF/A conversion PDFNEWNET-18912 Allow to create PDF Portfolio PDFNEWNET-22544 CGM to PDF conversion PDFNEWNET-26321 PDF to PDF/A-1a Conversion PDFNEWNET-30134 Allow to save the PDF to TIFF in A4 format instead of letter
Enhancements PDFNEWNET-30957 Implement collections PDFNEWNET-32157 Support documents that contains broken cross-reference tables PDFNEWNET-32223 Conversion of PDF pages to Images is slow PDFNEWNET-32339 Extract images with initial bit depth instead of using 32 bit RGB always PDFNEWNET-32486 Implement support streams without Length property specified PDFNEWNET-29274 Size difference in output generated with 2 approaches PDFNEWNET-26709 Performance Investigation - DoConvert stucks at page number 4 PDFNEWNET-32512 Investigate Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 1.0 PDFNEWNET-31746 Facades.Form disposes the source stream on Save() call PDFNEWNET-32526 Investigate the increase in file size after replacing the image
Exceptions PDFNEWNET-29890 ArgumentException when converting HTML file into PDF�PDFNEWNET-30637 NullReferenceException while converitng HTML to PDF PDFNEWNET-30791 NullReferenceException is being generated when converting PCL files into PDF PDFNEWNET-30930 OutOfMemoryException when concatenating two large PDF documents PDFNEWNET-31025 ArgumentException when converting PDF file into DOC format PDFNEWNET-31693 Object Reference Exception in HTML2PDF conversion PDFNEWNET-32014 PDF to Tiff conversion throws Null reference exception PDFNEWNET-32123 UnHandled exception during PDF to Image conversion PDFNEWNET-32137 Exception while converting PDF to TIFF PDFNEWNET-32311 Object Not Found Exception PDFNEWNET-32521 Exception on PdfFileEditor.Concatenate method PDFNEWNET-32828 PCL2PDF conversion: System.ArgumentNullException was unhandled PDFNEWNET-32825 HTML2PDF conversion exception: System.ArgumentNullException: Key cannot be null PDFNEWNET-32742 Exception "Unable to cast object of type ...." in TiffDevice.Process() method PDFNEWNET-32844 ContentEditor.DeleteStampById method gives System.ArgumentNullReference Exception PDFNEWNET-32900 Exception "User password can't be same as owner password" PDFNEWNET-32931 Exception: Pdf document has not been provided yet or it was closed after changing document security properties PDFNEWNET-33013 Thread Safety Issue PDFNEWNET-32400 When we try to add the solicitation number to the right side of the header, a 'corrupt content' exception is thrown PDFNEWNET-32677 Value cannot be null.Parameter name: key

FeedPackage.Summary: Aspose.Pdf for .NET is a PDF document creation and manipulation component that enables your .NET applications to read, write and manipulate existing PDF documents without using Adobe Acrobat. It also allows you to create forms and manage form fields embedded in a PDF document. This component is written in managed C# and it allows developers to add PDF creation and manipulation functionality to their Microsoft .NET applications (WinForms, ASP.NET and .NET Compact Framework). Aspose.Pdf for .NET is affordable and offers an incredible wealth of features including PDF compression options; table creation and manipulation; support for graph objects; extensive hyperlink functionality; extended security controls; custom font handling; integration with data sources; add or remove bookmarks; create table of contents; add, update, delete attachments and annotations; import or export PDF form data; add, replace or remove text and images; split, concatenate, extract or inset pages; transform pages to image; print PDF documents and much more.
FeedPackage.Tags: Aspose.Pdf PDF XPS TIFF PCL SVG XML XSL-FO FDF XFDF PDF/A form

FeedPackage.Title: Aspose.Pdf

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.Pdf for .NET is a PDF document creation and manipulation component that enables your .NET applications to read, write and manipulate existing PDF documents without using Adobe Acrobat. It also allows you to create forms and manage form fields embedded in a PDF document. This component is written in managed C# and it allows developers to add PDF creation and manipulation functionality to their Microsoft .NET applications (WinForms, ASP.NET and .NET Compact Framework). Aspose.Pdf for .NET is affordable and offers an incredible wealth of features including PDF compression options; table creation and manipulation; support for graph objects; extensive hyperlink functionality; extended security controls; custom font handling; integration with data sources; add or remove bookmarks; create table of contents; add, update, delete attachments and annotations; import or export PDF form data; add, replace or remove text and images; split, concatenate, extract or inset pages; transform pages to image; print PDF documents and much more.

FeedPackage.Title: Aspose.Pdf

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.Pdf for .NET is a PDF document creation and manipulation component that enables your .NET applications to read, write and manipulate existing PDF documents without using Adobe Acrobat. It also allows you to create forms and manage form fields embedded in a PDF document. This component is written in managed C# and it allows developers to add PDF creation and manipulation functionality to their Microsoft .NET applications (WinForms, ASP.NET and .NET Compact Framework). Aspose.Pdf for .NET is affordable and offers an incredible wealth of features including PDF compression options; table creation and manipulation; support for graph objects; extensive hyperlink functionality; extended security controls; custom font handling; integration with data sources; add or remove bookmarks; create table of contents; add, update, delete attachments and annotations; import or export PDF form data; add, replace or remove text and images; split, concatenate, extract or inset pages; transform pages to image; print PDF documents and much more.

FeedPackage.Title: Aspose.Pdf

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.Pdf for .NET is a PDF document creation and manipulation component that enables your .NET applications to read, write and manipulate existing PDF documents without using Adobe Acrobat. It also allows you to create forms and manage form fields embedded in a PDF document. This component is written in managed C# and it allows developers to add PDF creation and manipulation functionality to their Microsoft .NET applications (WinForms, ASP.NET and .NET Compact Framework). Aspose.Pdf for .NET is affordable and offers an incredible wealth of features including PDF compression options; table creation and manipulation; support for graph objects; extensive hyperlink functionality; extended security controls; custom font handling; integration with data sources; add or remove bookmarks; create table of contents; add, update, delete attachments and annotations; import or export PDF form data; add, replace or remove text and images; split, concatenate, extract or inset pages; transform pages to image; print PDF documents and much more.

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.Pdf for .NET is a PDF document creation and manipulation component that enables your .NET applications to read, write and manipulate existing PDF documents without using Adobe Acrobat. It also allows you to create forms and manage form fields embedded in a PDF document. This component is written in managed C# and it allows developers to add PDF creation and manipulation functionality to their Microsoft .NET applications (WinForms, ASP.NET and .NET Compact Framework). Aspose.Pdf for .NET is affordable and offers an incredible wealth of features including PDF compression options; table creation and manipulation; support for graph objects; extensive hyperlink functionality; extended security controls; custom font handling; integration with data sources; add or remove bookmarks; create table of contents; add, update, delete attachments and annotations; import or export PDF form data; add, replace or remove text and images; split, concatenate, extract or inset pages; transform pages to image; print PDF documents and much more.
FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes:
This release of latest hotfix for Aspose.Pdf for .NET contains the fixes for some high priority issues:
New Features PDFNEWNET-35373 save images in non-svg format while converting pdf to html PDFNEWNET-36377 Custom Property is not being accessed by Name
Enhancements PDFNEWNET-34703 BindFO method should accept Stream objects as an argument PDFNEWNET-36153 HTML to PDF conversion doesn't render textbox fields
Exceptions PDFNEWNET-35692 Unable to save output in Stream when using product in trial mode PDFNEWNET-35801 NullReferenceException: Corrupt PDF document PDFNEWNET-36360 PdfConverter object throwing NullReferenceException
Bugs PDFNEWNET-36363 PDF to PNG conversion loses colors PDFNEWNET-36383 Problem converting PDF file to PDFA2b
FeedPackage.Summary: Aspose.Pdf for .NET is an amazing component which provides the feature to create and manipulate PDF documents.
FeedPackage.Tags: Aspose.Pdf PDF XFA XPS TIFF PCL SVG HTML XML XSL-FO FDF XFDF PDF/A form Portfolio EPUB PSD to XLS DOC
FeedPackage.Title: Aspose.Pdf

This component is written in managed C# and it allows developers to add PDF creation and manipulation functionality to their Microsoft .NET applications (WinForms, ASP.NET and .NET Compact Framework). Aspose.Pdf for .NET is affordable and offers an incredible wealth of features including PDF compression options; table creation and manipulation; support for graph objects; extensive hyperlink functionality; extended security controls; custom font handling; integration with data sources; add or remove bookmarks; create table of contents; add, update, delete attachments and annotations; import or export PDF form data; add, replace or remove text and images; split, concatenate, extract or inset pages; transform pages to image; print PDF documents and much more.
FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes:
This release introduces the features, enhancements and bug fixes as detailed below:

PDFNEWNET-36115 Change page orientation from Portrait to landscape PDFNEWNET-36340 Create single HTML file output with embedded resoruces PDFNEWNET-36608 PDF to HTML - embed CSS inside HTML PDFNEWNET-37337 Retrieve RadioHoriz property for RadioButton field

FeedPackage.Title: Aspose.Pdf

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.Pdf for .NET is a PDF document creation and manipulation component that enables your .NET applications to read, write and manipulate existing PDF documents without using Adobe Acrobat. It also allows you to create forms and manage form fields embedded in a PDF document. This component is written in managed C# and it allows developers to add PDF creation and manipulation functionality to their Microsoft .NET applications (WinForms, ASP.NET and .NET Compact Framework). Aspose.Pdf for .NET is affordable and offers an incredible wealth of features including PDF compression options; table creation and manipulation; support for graph objects; extensive hyperlink functionality; extended security controls; custom font handling; integration with data sources; add or remove bookmarks; create table of contents; add, update, delete attachments and annotations; import or export PDF form data; add, replace or remove text and images; split, concatenate, extract or inset pages; transform pages to image; print PDF documents and much more.

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.Pdf for .NET is a PDF document creation and manipulation component that enables your .NET applications to read, write and manipulate existing PDF documents without using Adobe Acrobat. It also allows you to create forms and manage form fields embedded in a PDF document. This component is written in managed C# and it allows developers to add PDF creation and manipulation functionality to their Microsoft .NET applications (WinForms, ASP.NET and .NET Compact Framework). Aspose.Pdf for .NET is affordable and offers an incredible wealth of features including PDF compression options; table creation and manipulation; support for graph objects; extensive hyperlink functionality; extended security controls; custom font handling; integration with data sources; add or remove bookmarks; create table of contents; add, update, delete attachments and annotations; import or export PDF form data; add, replace or remove text and images; split, concatenate, extract or inset pages; transform pages to image; print PDF documents and much more.

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.Pdf.Builder is a toolkit designed to make developing with Aspose.Pdf a breeze. It contains a variety of functions which allows a user to develop complex and flexible page components without having to dig in too deeply into the intricacies of Aspose.Pdf.

FeedPackage.Summary:
Aspose.Pdf.Builder is a toolkit designed to make developing with Aspose.Pdf a seamless experience.
Note, users will need a valid Aspose.Pdf license if you wish to enjoy Aspose.Pdf fully.

FeedPackage.Description:
Aspose.Pdf for Cloud is a REST API for creating and editing PDF files. It can also be used to convert PDF files to different formats like DOC, HTML, XPS, TIFF and many more. Aspose.Pdf for Cloud gives you control: create PDFs from scratch or from HTML, XML, template, database, XPS or an image. Render PDFs to image formats such as JPEG, PNG, GIF, BMP, TIFF and many others.
Aspose.Pdf for Cloud helps you manipulate elements of a PDF file like text, annotations, watermarks, signatures, bookmarks, stamps and so on. Its REST API also allows you to manage PDF pages by using features like merging, splitting, and inserting. Add images to a PDF file or convert PDF pages to images.
FeedPackage.Tags: Aspose.Pdf Aspose.Pdf-Cloud PDF XFA XPS TIFF PCL SVG HTML XML XSL-FO FDF XFDF PDF/A form Portfolio EPUB PSD to XLS DOC

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.Slides is a PowerPoint management library for working with Microsoft PowerPoint files without using Microsoft PowerPoint. It allows developers to work with PPT, PPS, POT, PPTX, PPSX, POTX and ODP files on ASP.NET web applications, web services and Windows applications.
FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes:
This release introduces the features, enhancements and bug fixes as detailed below:
Bugs SLIDESNET-31428 Exception thrown in multithreaded environment SLIDESNET-32004 The embedded video on the slide is lost SLIDESNET-32403 ChartSeriesEx.MarkerFill returns null SLIDESNET-32553 IndexOutofRangeException on exporting to PDF SLIDESNET-32554 IndexOutofRangeException on accessing presentation SLIDESNET-31331 Aspose.Slides generated PDF is greater in size as generated by PowerPoint
FeedPackage.Summary: Aspose.Slides is a PowerPoint management library for working with Microsoft PowerPoint files without using Microsoft PowerPoint. It allows developers to work with PPT, PPS, POT, PPTX, PPSX, POTX and ODP files on ASP.NET web applications, web services and Windows applications. It allows you to open files and manipulate the elements of the presentation from adding slides and managing variety of shapes and working with text to more complex elements like presentation protection, slide animations, charts and SmartArt rendering.The presentations can be exported to PDF, TIFF, XPS, SVG, PNG, JPEG, BMP or EMF formats.
FeedPackage.Tags: PowerPoint presentations Aspose.Slides PPT PPTX POTX POT PPS PPSX ODT

FeedPackage.Summary: Aspose.Slides is a PowerPoint management library for working with Microsoft PowerPoint files without using Microsoft PowerPoint. It allows developers to work with PPT, PPS, POT, PPTX, PPSX, POTX and ODP files on ASP.NET web applications, web services and Windows applications. It allows you to open files and manipulate the elements of the presentation from adding slides and managing variety of shapes and working with text to more complex elements like presentation protection, slide animations, charts and SmartArt rendering.The presentations can be exported to PDF, TIFF, XPS, SVG, PNG, JPEG, BMP or EMF formats.
FeedPackage.Tags: PowerPoint presentations Aspose.Slides PPT PPTX POTX POT PPS PPSX ODT

FeedPackage.Summary: Aspose.Slides is a PowerPoint management library for working with Microsoft PowerPoint files without using Microsoft PowerPoint. It allows developers to work with PPT, PPS, POT, PPTX, PPSX, POTX and ODP files on ASP.NET web applications, web services and Windows applications. It allows you to open files and manipulate the elements of the presentation from adding slides and managing variety of shapes and working with text to more complex elements like presentation protection, slide animations, charts and SmartArt rendering.The presentations can be exported to PDF, TIFF, XPS, SVG, PNG, JPEG, BMP or EMF formats.

FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes:
This release introduces the features, enhancements and bug fixes as detailed below:
Major Features
(SLIDESNET-31307) - SmartArt: support loading, saving, editing, and 2d-rendering SmartArt objects
Minor Features
(SLIDESNET-34344) - Write capability for linked OLE objects in PPTX presentations (SLIDESNET-33982) - Support for MultiLevelCategoryAxisLabels in Aspose.Slides (SLIDESNET-33457) - Setting default zoom size for presentation when it will open in PowerPoint
Other Improvements and Changes
(SLIDESNET-34862) - Include Dashboards with the Product release (SLIDESNET-34859) - Add Online EULA Button in MSI installer (SLIDESNET-34850) - Write XML comments for FillTypeEx and its members.
Bugs
(SLIDESNET-34877) - Text color inside the shapes is changed after PPT is converted to PPTX (SLIDESNET-34867) - Hyperlink is lost when PPTX presentation is exported to PDF (SLIDESNET-34866) - AutoShape hyperlinks are lost during PPT to PPTX conversion (SLIDESNET-34832) - Images are lost after saving presentation (SLIDESNET-34767) - Notes are not proper after copying (SLIDESNET-34670) - Font substitution works differently for PDF and Thumbnail (SLIDESNET-34656) - Series marker symbols get disappered when Aspose.Slides generated presenation opened in Slide show (SLIDESNET-34471) - Hyperlink is lost on text in generated HTML (SLIDESNET-34470) - Hyperlink on image is lost is generated PDF and HTML (SLIDESNET-34464) - Text improperly rendered in generated PDF (SLIDESNET-33404) - SmartArt text renders upside down (SLIDESNET-33286) - Merging Cells causes extra column to appear in 2.8.2 PPT (SLIDESNET-33195) - Setting the SmartArt background color does not work (SLIDESNET-33183) - Horizontal Text rendered as vertical and vertical text rendered as horizontal for SmartArt
Exceptions
(SLIDESNET-34382) - OutOfMemoryException on exporting PPT to PDF

This release provides new unified API for PPTX and PPT documents and COM Interop support. It isn�t intended for production because PPT processing has not fully implemented yet.
During next two months Aspose.Slides for .NET 8.x and Aspose.Slides for .NET 14.x will be being published at the same time. But new features will be added only to 14.x.
Major Features
(SLIDESNET-30297) - COM Interfaces for Aspose.Slides (SLIDESNET-13419) - Unite object model for PPT and PPTX formats support
Public API and Backwards Incompatible Changes
Aspose.Slides for .NET 13.12.0.0 release provides completely new unified interface for PPT and PPTX documents processing.

FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes:
Aspose.Slides for .NET 8.3.0 Release Notes Aspose.Slides for .NET has been updated to version 8.3.0. This release includes enhancements and bug fixes.
Using Aspose.Slides for .NET you can work with PPT, PPTX, OpenDocument, and other formats in your applications. You can also view, generate, modify, convert, render and print presentations all without using Microsoft PowerPoint.
Visit the documentation to learn how to get started with Aspose.Slides for .NET.
Note this download contains a fully working version of the product, however without a license set it will run in evaluation mode. To test Aspose.Slides without these evaluation limitations you can request a free 30-day temporary license.
The following is a list of changes in this version of Aspose.Slides. Improvements and Changes Bugs
(SLIDESNET-34896) PPT to HTML Generation (Bullets are not converted properly) (SLIDESNET-34963) Hyperlinks in HTML are missing (SLIDESNET-34939) Images inside presentation are getting stretched on changing master slide (SLIDESNET-34935) Text overlaps for Pie chart labels in generated PDF (SLIDESNET-34928) Background gradient changing after transforming to PDF (SLIDESNET-34927) Extra lines are appearing in the charts when exported to PDF (SLIDESNET-34926) Numbered bullets changed to symbol in generated PDF (SLIDESNET-34886) pdfOptions.SaveMetafilesAsPng = false does not seem to work (SLIDESNET-34873) Hyperlinks are multiplied when PPTX presentation is exported to PDF (SLIDESNET-34864) Data exceeds slide in generated PDF (SLIDESNET-34861) Alpha value for color is ignored while setting shape color (SLIDESNET-34860) Chart labels are rendered as horizontal in generated thumbnails (SLIDESNET-34853) Color.Empty doesn't handled as a transparent background color in PPTX (SLIDESNET-34735) Small Caps changed to small letters in exported PDF (SLIDESNET-34680) Chart labels is incorrectly rendered in generated PDF (SLIDESNET-17212) Black box appearing around table in generated PDF using PDF A-1B format (SLIDESNET-16801) Hand writen signature missing in generated PDF (SLIDESNET-7566) Bullet Font Incorrect � Works in 2.8.4.0 but broken in new versions (SLIDESNET-3792) SWF file does not play automatically
Exceptions
(SLIDESNET-34907) Exception on saving Aspose.Slides generated presentation (SLIDESNET-34868) Internal MethodAccessException when drawing a PPTX slide on the canvas (SLIDESNET-34825) IndexOutOfRange exception on adding HTML in text frame (SLIDESNET-34783) IndexOutOfRange Exception on saving presentation (SLIDESNET-34786) FormatException on loading the presentation using Aspose.Slides (SLIDESNET-23830) IndexOutOfBoundArray Exception on opening presentation
Public API and Backwards Incompatible Changes ChangeMaster(Aspose.Slides.Slide master, System.Boolean changeStyle, System.Boolean placeholderRelayouting) method has been added to Slide class This method allows keeping placeholders� layout when master slide is changed. Shapes keep size and position when the placeholderRelayouting parameter is �false� otherwise shapes are updated according to new master slide layout.
// presentation with the first placeholders layout Presentation p1 = new Presentation("Presentation1.ppt"); // presetnation with the second placeholders layout Presentation p2 = new Presentation("Presentation2.ppt"); p2.Slides.Remove(p2.GetSlideByPosition(1)); SortedList list = new SortedList(); p1.CloneSlide(p1.GetSlideByPosition(1), p2.Slides.LastSlidePosition + 1, p2, list); p1.CloneSlide(p1.GetSlideByPosition(1), p2.Slides.LastSlidePosition + 1, p2, list); // slide from the first presentation and with the second placeholders layout (default behavior) p2.GetSlideByPosition(1).ChangeMaster(p2.MainMaster, true); // slide form the first presentation and with the first placeholder layout (new behavior) p2.GetSlideByPosition(2).ChangeMaster(p2.MainMaster, true, false); p2.Save("out.ppt", SaveFormat.Ppt);

FeedPackage.Description: Aspose.Slides is a PowerPoint management library for working with Microsoft PowerPoint files without using Microsoft PowerPoint. It allows developers to work with PPT, PPS, POT, PPTX, PPSX, POTX and ODP files on ASP.NET web applications, web services and Windows applications.
FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes:
This release provides new unified API for PPTX and PPT documents and COM Interop support.
Using Aspose.Slides for .NET you can work with PPT, PPTX, OpenDocument, and other formats in your applications. You can also view, generate, modify, convert, render and print presentations all without using Microsoft PowerPoint.
The following is a list of changes in this version of Aspose.Slides.
Major Features
SLIDESNET-34890 Merge "SmartArt: support loading, saving, editing, and 2d-rendering SmartArt objects" into Aspose.Slides 14.1.0
Other Improvements and Changes
Bugs
SLIDESNET-34974 Exception on Opening a PPT file: Couldn't read "PowerPoint Document" record. SLIDESNET-34944 Exception thrown "Couldn't read "PowerPoint Document" record." on opening a PPT file with Embedded Object
Known issues and limitations
Aspose.Slide .NET 14.1.0 is new and quality decision for PowerPoint documents processing. There are some restrictions which will be removed in the 14.2.0 release:
Some shapes have wrong geometry in serialized PPT documents (Call outs). Not all PPTX text formatting features are supported in PPT serialization (tabulation, indentation and paragraph formatting limitations). Info about text language and spelling settings is not present in serialized PPT documents. Not all PPTX themes� features are supported in PPT serialization (only serialization of fill formats, line formats and font). There are known issues in OLE/ActiveX PPT serialization to PPT.

It allows you to open files and manipulate the elements of the presentation from adding slides and managing variety of shapes and working with text to more complex elements like presentation protection, slide animations, charts and SmartArt rendering.The presentations can be exported to PDF, TIFF, XPS, SVG, PNG, JPEG, BMP or EMF formats.

Major Features None Minor Features None Other Improvements and Changes Bugs (SLIDESNET-35020) - Implement dual signing (SLIDESNET-35019) - NullPointerException on accessing the SmartArt shape font (SLIDESNET-35012) - Missing text in SmartArt for exported PDF (SLIDESNET-35010) - PPTX Exception thrown "Input string is not in correct format" (SLIDESNET-35007) - Charts missing in generated thumbnails (SLIDESNET-34991) - Exception when importing HTML to ParagraphExCollection (SLIDESNET-34971) - Strikethrough text style is not applied when text is imported from HTML to ParagraphExCollection (SLIDESNET-34965) - NullPointer Exception on accessing the presentation (SLIDESNET-34943) - Index Out of Bound Exception is thrown when calling AddFromHTML method (SLIDESNET-34845) - Chart missing in generaed thumbnail (SLIDESNET-34834) - Subscript and Superscripts failed to import from html in text frame (SLIDESNET-34833) - Strike through failed to import from html in text frame (SLIDESNET-34699) - Chart label borders failed to show if custom label type is used (SLIDESNET-34692) - Chart series markers are not getting disabled when MarkerStyle to None (SLIDESNET-34413) - Gaps between chart lines missing (SLIDESNET-34256) - The bullets are improperly rendered in generated HTML for ODP presenation (SLIDESNET-34254) - The bullet characters are improperly rendered in generated HTML (SLIDESNET-34252) - Title placeholder renders twice in generated HTML (SLIDESNET-24322) - Shape protection for group shapes not working

FeedPackage.ReleaseNotes: Aspose.Slides for .NET 14.2.0 Release Notes We are pleased to announce the release of Aspose.Slides for .NET 14.2.0. This release includes several enhancements and many bug fixes. Using Aspose.Slides for .NET you can work with PPT, PPTX, OpenDocument, and other formats in your applications. You can also view, generate, modify, convert, render and print presentations all without using Microsoft PowerPoint. Visit the documentation to learn how to get started with Aspose.Slides for .NET. Note this download contains a fully working version of the product, however without a license set it will run in evaluation mode. To test Aspose.Slides without these evaluation limitations you can request a free 30-day temporary license. The following is a list of changes in this version of Aspose.Slides. Minor Features (SLIDESNET-35029) - Support for Clearing / Updating a Hyperlink in the new merged API of Aspose.Slides for .NET (SLIDESNET-35037) - Design and implement API for manage OverrideTheme object (SLIDESNET-35020) - Implement dual signing (SLIDESNET-34898) - Support numbered and unnumbered list styles when importing paragraph text from HTML Other Improvements and Changes Bugs (SLIDESNET-35187) - Attempt to import slides from the HTML results in NRE (SLIDESNET-35171) - Export PPTX to HTML with Images in JPEG format (SLIDESNET-35166) - NullReference Exception on accessing presentation (SLIDESNET-35165) - Found a shapes with identical IDs Exception when accessing presentation (SLIDESNET-35148) - PPT StypeTextPropAtom reading issues (SLIDESNET-35143) - System.FormatException is thrown when presentation with chart is opened (SLIDESNET-35141) - WriteToSVG cuts the text after Ampersand sign (SLIDESNET-35132) - System.ArgumentException is thrown when AddDataPointFor... methods are called (SLIDESNET-35129) - NullReferenceException is thrown when presentation with chart is saved (SLIDESNET-35104) - SVG Image is not showing up in the generated PPTX file from HTML (SLIDESNET-35097) - NullReferenceException is thrown when the presentation is saved to PPTX (SLIDESNET-35095) - Saving a PPTX presentation results in a broken presentation (SLIDESNET-35091) - The font color is changed from white to black in generated PDF (SLIDESNET-35090) - Improper pptx->html converting (SLIDESNET-35079) - StackOverflowException while Pptx to Pdf saving (SLIDESNET-35078) - Importing HTML Text in PPTX is not working fine (SLIDESNET-35074) - ArgumentoutOfRangeException when importing HTML text with lists (SLIDESNET-35061) - Fix regression on TC (SLIDESNET-35056) - Changing the angles in setLinearGradientAngle doesn't have an effect. (SLIDESNET-35044) - Exception "Input String was not in correct format" thrown on opening the PPTX file (SLIDESNET-35031) - Text with underline effect rendering issues (SLIDESNET-35023) - NullReference Exception on accessing presentation (SLIDESNET-35012) - missing text in SmartArt for exported PDF (SLIDESNET-35010) - PPTX Exception thrown "Input string is not in correct format" (SLIDESNET-34993) - NullReference Exception on accessing presentation (SLIDESNET-34975) - Strike-through line is missing for text in generated PDF (SLIDESNET-34940) - Text disappearing after conversion from PPT to PDF (SLIDESNET-34912) - PPTX to PNG: SmartArt Text shows upside down in generated PNG file (SLIDESNET-34909) - KeyNotFound Exception on accessing presenation for cloning in using merged API (SLIDESNET-34878) - PPTX to HTML (SVG) export is incorrect (SLIDESNET-34865) - AutoShapes get corrupted when PPT presentation is exported to PDF (SLIDESNET-34253) - The strike through text effect is missing in generated HTML Known Issues and Limitations There are several known bugs, which appear during some presentations processing. (SLIDESNET-35151) - Wrong chart outline PDF and PNG rendering (SLIDESNET-35149) - PPT to PPTX conversion creates corrupted presentation (SLIDESNET-35147) - IndexOutOfRangeException is thrown when presentation with chart is loaded (SLIDESNET-35146) - PPTX to PDF conversion issues (SLIDESNET-35138) - Shape shadow is not present in thumbnail (SLIDESNET-35134) - Chart is corrupt after presentation cloning (SLIDESNET-35133) - PPT DocumentProperties.HiperlinkBase property read/write issue (SLIDESNET-35128) - Chart properties read/write operations issues Public API and Backwards Incompatible Changes Methods Aspose.Slides.IPresentation.Write(�) are removed These methods wrote Presentation objects only to PPTX format file. In new API, the Presentation class is for working with all formats. It is possible to use Presentation.Save(�) methods for saving Presentation objects to all supported formats. Classes related to theme styles are moved to Aspose.Slides.Theme namespace Types ColorScheme, EffectStyle, EffectStyleCollection, EffectStyleCollectionEffectiveData, ExtraColorSchemeCollection, ExtraColorSchemeCollection, ExtraColorScheme, FillFormatCollection, FillFormatCollectionEffectiveData, FontScheme, FontSchemeEffectiveData, FormatScheme, IColorScheme, IEffectStyle, IEffectStyleCollection, IEffectStyleCollectionEffectiveData, IEffectStyleEffectiveData, IExtraColorScheme, IExtraColorSchemeCollection, IFillFormatCollection, IFillFormatCollectionEffectiveData, IFontScheme, IFontSchemeEffectiveData, IFormatScheme, ILineFormatCollection, ILineFormatCollectionEffectiveData moved from Aspose.Slides namespace to Aspose.Slides.Theme namespace. Changes from Aspose.Slides for .NET 8.0 .. Aspose.Slides for .NET 8.4 are added to Aspose.Slides for .NET 14.2.0
FeedPackage.Summary: Aspose.Slides is a PowerPoint management library for working with Microsoft PowerPoint files without using Microsoft PowerPoint. It allows developers to work with PPT, PPS, POT, PPTX, PPSX, POTX and ODP files on ASP.NET web applications, web services and Windows applications. It allows you to open files and manipulate the elements of the presentation from adding slides and managing variety of shapes and working with text to more complex elements like presentation protection, slide animations, charts and SmartArt rendering.The presentations can be exported to PDF, TIFF, XPS, SVG, PNG, JPEG, BMP or EMF formats.
FeedPackage.Tags: PowerPoint presentations Aspose.Slides PPT PPTX POTX POT PPS PPSX ODT
